Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in WWII Japan, covers the famine intensifying around him, and delves into his eventual decision to send himself on a dangerous adventure to stop his sister from continuing suffering. This is a fine musical with a timeless score by one of my favorite composers (Gershwin) and a nice 'Parisien' atmosphere which gives the Boston Opera Company an excuse to build its new wonderland ,which since 1980 , has been for me the finest place to see an opera.
The Pré-Raphaelites and a few good plays with or without any music all offered an evening of good, nay great, theatre for which I am very grateful.
